H0.text: What six letter word is used to describe the soft skin that covers a deer's antlers as they develop . Velour

H1.text: What six letter word is used to describe the soft skin that covers a deer's antlers as they develop . Follic

H2.text: What six letter word is used to describe the soft skin that covers a deer's antlers as they develop . Cuticle

H3.text: What six letter word is used to describe the soft skin that covers a deer's antlers as they develop . Pann√©

A4.text: Velour is a pile knit fabric, usually of polyester.

A5.text: While an antler is growing, it is covered with highly vascular skin called velvet.

A6.text: While an antler is growing, it is covered with highly vascular skin called velvet, which supplies oxygen and nutrients to the growing bone.

A7.text: The antlers emerge as soft tissues (known as velvet antlers) and progressively harden into bony structures.
